Articles.Content:
So I tried KSP back when it was at 0.8.4. Now I\'m on 0.13 and loving it. The best part is that I\'m running it in linux- 64-bit Debian Sid 8) - through WINE, and it runs well, even though my comp doesn\'t meet the minimum requirements ( 22-28FPS in a 1024x768 window).

Here\'s my first contribution to the Kerbal Space Program: the Aerophallus series rocket. Large, powerful, and always pointing straight up no matter the conditions, it\'s the largest example of overcompensation anywhere

The mark I and II differ only in the number of fins on the upper stage- the mark II uses only half as many wings as the mark I\'s eight wings in order to save weight. Pilots with a lead foot are contraindicated (looking at you Jeb!), as the sheer power at the pilot\'s fingertips makes it trivially easy to overshoot the moon, and possibly beyond.

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Captain Sordid

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky
